Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; faded added white outline of tendrils and lower part of rosette complex; below, two faded white bands above zigzag pattern; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of siren to left (hair and wing with added red patches; trace of curlicue; dotted scale pattern on body).
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93). For parallels regarding the siren, see Lemos 1991, pl. 88, no. 675 from Pitane.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 258, no. 478)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0545) (phase 2)
